common_issues.title: PiecesOS Feature Activation Failures
common_issues.description: Users report various PiecesOS features, such as Ollama, LTM, and Workstream activity, fail to activate or function correctly.  This is often linked to permission issues, software bugs, or compatibility problems with specific hardware or operating systems. Solutions include granting permissions, restarting PiecesOS, waiting for bug fixes, or contacting support for assistance.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Pieces-LLM Ollama Installation Error

**Key Points Raised:**

* Ollama installation fails with an error message indicating the program `curl` is not found.
* This issue occurs specifically when using Pieces-OS installed as a snap package.
* Snap packages run in a sandboxed environment with limited access to system resources.
* The error prevents both downloading and using local LLM models.

**Problems Identified:**

* Dependency on `curl` was not declared in the snap definition file.
* Pieces-OS snap package cannot access external executables like `curl`.
* This issue remained unresolved for several weeks.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Add `curl` to the list of dependency packages in the Pieces-OS snap definition file.
* Patch Pieces-OS to allow access and use of Ollama within the sandboxed environment.
* Provide a temporary workaround for downloading LLMs manually (not implemented due to limitations).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Solution is in progress, with a fix expected to be released soon.
* Users are waiting for the fix to be implemented.
* Until then, local LLM model functionality remains unavailable in Pieces-OS snap packages.

**Additional Notes:**

* Several users have commented on the issue, expressing frustration and concern about the delay in resolution.
* This issue highlights the challenges of security and resource access in sandboxed environments.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS unable to enable LTM
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS unable to enable LTM
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When attempting to enable the LTM engine, either in the Pieces desktop app by clicking "Allow" for "Periodic Application Indexing" or in the Pieces OS directly, clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine", nothing happens. Even after multiple Pieces OS restarts and a clean install. 

Tailed the local log while doing both operations, only clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine" resulted in logs:
```
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 351d4b13dbae46589cabd593569f9049
```

[piecesOS-03162025log.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19275571/piecesOS-03162025log.txt)
Also confirmed permissions were granted appropriately:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2fa7002e-0c18-46fe-abaf-288350a90b1b)

Loop in Detail:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c964a15d-2307-4d83-a9f8-0d82d7b608b8

I can reproduce quickly and easily if you need more details/fresh logs!
## Issue Summary: Pieces LTM Activation Problem 

**Key points:**

* User (@kwburgess) reported an issue activating the LTM engine on PiecesOS.
* Pieces Support Bot (@pieces-support-bot) triaged and suggested related issues and resources while assigning it to the relevant team.
* Support team member (@mark-at-pieces) reached out and identified the problem as missing permission for PiecesOS.
* User confirmed that the system wasn't reporting the required permissions as enabled, leading to the problem.

**Solutions:**

* @mark-at-pieces provided screenshots highlighting necessary permissions for Screen & System recording and Accessibility.
* He also offered the option for a real-time resolution via his calendar link.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User acknowledged the solution and expressed their understanding. 
* Further communication or updates weren't provided in the conversation, so the outcome remains open-ended. 

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation was from March 2025.

When using LTM-2 to test the secret message example:
https://pieces.app/magic-moments/ltm

I got a strange response from the LLM:
Claude 3.5:
First Try:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1962a3e4-8b02-4d3f-bc8c-4bdd72c80aa6)
2. try: (waited longer on the website)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd71c5c1-d5d5-4449-acd5-e070fb244fa9)

Gemini 2.0 Flash did fail completely:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50735f7a-28a1-4563-b490-e10c271eca23)
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation

### Key points raised:

* Some users experiencing PiecesOS running in "basic mode" due to device constraints (M3 MacBooks).
* This issue prevents access to some features like workstream activity and LTM updates.
* An unknown application with version 1.0.10 listed in the telemetry browser.
* Workstream Activity view not accessible in Desktop application.

### Problems identified:

* Bug causing PiecesOS to enter "basic mode" incorrectly.
* Lack of clear indication when in "basic mode".
* Limited functionality in "basic mode".
* Workstream Activity view not visible in certain window sizes.
* Unknown application listed in telemetry browser.

### Solutions proposed/implemented:

* Fix for the "basic mode" bug to be released in the next PiecesOS version.
* Restarting PiecesOS can temporarily resolve the "basic mode" issue.
* Enhancement to the "basic mode" view to make it more intuitive.
* Investigating the unknown application listed in the telemetry browser.

### Current status/outcome:

* "Basic mode" bug fix pending release in the next PiecesOS version.
* Workstream Activity view accessibility issue confirmed and solution being investigated.
* Unknown application investigation ongoing.

### Notes:

* This summary focuses on the most recent conversation and does not include details from related issues mentioned in the initial comments.
* Screenshots and additional information provided by users are not included in this summary but are available in the original conversation.

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## GitHub Issue Summary:

**Issue:** Copilot not responding properly, no files loaded into context after 11 requests and responses.

**Key Points:**

* User @seantiz reported the bug after experiencing it with 11 requests and responses.
* User was unable to reproduce the issue on demand.
* LLM being used was not specified.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Support suggested switching to Gemini 2.0 Flash LLM.
* User confirmed the bug did not occur with Flash.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue believed to be fixed in the next release based on Flash behavior.
* Issue closed pending confirmation after update to 11.2.3.

related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces desktop application is working very much slow after latest update, takes very much time to give any response. Even after doing a hard reset active runtime, it just do not work. 
## Copilot performance issue summary

**Key points:**

* Copilot was experiencing lag after clicking "Hard-Reset Active Runtime"
* This issue was due to a bug that prevented a websocket from re-initializing
* A fix was released in version 10.0.2 of Pieces OS and version 3.0.2 of Pieces Desktop

**Problems identified:**

* Infinite loading after "Hard-Reset Active Runtime"
* Lag and error-prone behavior

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Fix for the websocket bug 
* Released updates to Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop

**Current status/outcome:**

* Copilot should be performing better after the latest updates
* Some users may still be experiencing issues, and help is available from the Pieces team

**Additional notes:**

* The team is actively working on further improving Copilot performance.
* Users can contact the Pieces team through the link in the comment dated July 23, 2024, or by email as mentioned on March 19, 2025.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS High CPU Usage and Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report high CPU usage, slow performance, and lag, particularly with Long Term Memory (LTM) enabled. Issues are more prominent on Windows with apps like Slack, Discord, and Edge. Workarounds include disabling LTM, restarting LTM, and moving specific folders to ReFS drives. The Pieces team is actively working on solutions, with some fixes already released.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: PiecesOS High CPU Usage

**Key points raised:**

* High CPU usage observed on Windows 10 and 11, especially with Microsoft Edge and Discord
* Issue related to Long Term Memory engine (LTM) feature
* Turning LTM off temporarily resolves the issue

**Problems identified:**

* High CPU usage affects performance and causes system lag
* Issue seems to be specifically related to certain applications and the LTM engine

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Hotfix released for Windows 11.2.2
* Further patch for CPU usage improvement under development
* Moving com.pieces.os/com.pieces.pfd folders to a ReFS drive and creating symbolic links improved performance for some users

**Current status/outcome:**

* Issue partially resolved with improvements in CPU usage
* Still ongoing investigation by the Pieces team
* No permanent fix identified yet

**Additional notes:**

* It might be helpful to restart LTM to temporarily decrease CPU usage
* Moving certain folders to ReFS and creating symbolic links might improve performance for some users

**Overall, the issue of high CPU usage in PiecesOS has been acknowledged by the Pieces team and is actively being addressed. While a permanent fix is not yet available, some workarounds and improvements have been identified.**

related_issues.title: Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
related_issues.text:
Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @bpluly experienced multiple issues with the Pieces application: Long Term Memory slowdown, PiecesOS launch failure, and slow boot-up time.
* The user ultimately uninstalled the product due to a negative first impression.

**Problems Identified:**

* Multiple software bugs impacting user experience.
* Poor user onboarding and first-time user experience.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces support bot automatically routed the issue to the relevant team member.
* The support team offered helpful resources and suggested related issues for reference.
* The Pieces support representative, Mark, reached out to the user directly via comment and offered a call to discuss the issues and troubleshoot.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user did not respond to the call offer.
* The issue remains open and unresolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* This issue highlights the importance of addressing software bugs and providing a positive first-time user experience.
* Proactive communication and support from the team are crucial to retaining users who encounter problems.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving high CPU usage and performance issues:** This is a recurring problem, especially on Windows, and significantly impacts user experience. Focus on optimizing LTM functionality and resource consumption.

**Improve PiecesOS and Desktop app connection stability:** Address issues related to personal domain backup/restore, automatic cloud connections, and app launch failures to ensure seamless integration.
**Investigate and resolve Copilot's vague responses:** Determine the root cause of Copilot providing unhelpful responses and implement solutions to ensure accurate and actionable assistance.

**Provide clearer communication and documentation on PiecesOS features:** Many issues stem from users struggling with LTM activation, permissions, and functionality. Enhance user guides and in-app instructions.
**Proactively monitor and address common issues:** Use the data on frequent issues and active tickets to anticipate problems, prepare solutions, and update users proactively.
